Psychology_tweet_144.News Finding: New #ReadiLab piece online describing enhanced pleasure from smoking cigs while drinking but not while smoking pot
Psychology_tweet_144.Paper Finding: In contrast, there was on average no change in perceived pleasure from smoking cigarettes when using marijuana (5.3 ± 2.7, t (199) ¼ 1.7, p ¼ .09).
Psychology_tweet_144.News Context: New #ReadiLab piece online describing enhanced pleasure from smoking cigs while drinking but not while smoking pot
Psychology_tweet_144.Paper Context: Individuals reported an increase in perceived pleasure from smoking cigarettes when drinking alcohol (7.0 ± 2.2 versus null hypothesis 5 ¼ "no increase or decrease in pleasure"; t (199) ¼13.0, p < .001). In contrast, there was on average no change in perceived pleasure from smoking cigarettes when using marijuana (5.3 ± 2.7, t (199) ¼ 1.7, p ¼ .09). Perceived pleasure from smoking cigarettes did not differ by frequency of binge drinking (F (3,200) ¼ 0.84, p ¼ .47): nonbinge (7.1 ± 2.1), 1-3 binge days (6.8 ± 2.3), 4-8 binge days (7.0 ± 2.1), 9 þ binge days (7.6 ± 2.2).
Psychology_tweet_144.text:
['Finding A: New #ReadiLab piece online describing enhanced pleasure from smoking cigs while drinking but not while smoking pot
Finding B: In contrast, there was on average no change in perceived pleasure from smoking cigarettes when using marijuana (5.3 ± 2.7, t (199) ¼ 1.7, p ¼ .09).']
Psychology_tweet_144.displayed_text:
Finding A: New #ReadiLab piece online describing enhanced pleasure from smoking cigs while drinking but not while smoking pot
Finding B: In contrast, there was on average no change in perceived pleasure from smoking cigarettes when using marijuana (5.3 ± 2.7, t (199) ¼ 1.7, p ¼ .09).

Psychology_tweet_220.News Finding: Dog's gaze following tuned to human communicative signals:
Psychology_tweet_220.Paper Finding: Furthermore, dogs followed the actor's gaze significantly less in the BC compared to the O condition [cumulative accuracy, two-sample t test, t(24) = 22.107, p = 0.045].
Psychology_tweet_220.News Context: Dog's gaze following tuned to human communicative signals:
Psychology_tweet_220.Paper Context: Importantly, however, the accuracy indexes calculated for the cueing phase did not capture gaze following in BC [mean 6 SEM of cumulative accuracy: 20.06 6 0.14; one-sample t test, t(12) = 20.433; p = 0.67; first look: 0.11 6 0.16; one-sample t test, t(12) = 0.695; p = 0.5]. Furthermore, dogs followed the actor's gaze significantly less in the BC compared to the O condition [cumulative accuracy, two-sample t test, t(24) = 22.107, p = 0.045]. These data suggest that the lack of gaze following, when there are no ostensive signals, cannot be accounted for by the confounding effect of ''artificial'' salient attention getter used in the NO condition, also providing further support for the significant role of ostensive signals in dogs' gaze response.
Psychology_tweet_220.text:
['Finding A: Dog\'s gaze following tuned to human communicative signals:
Finding B: Furthermore, dogs followed the actor\'s gaze significantly less in the BC compared to the O condition [cumulative accuracy, two-sample t test, t(24) = 22.107, p = 0.045].']
Psychology_tweet_220.displayed_text:
Finding A: Dog's gaze following tuned to human communicative signals:
Finding B: Furthermore, dogs followed the actor's gaze significantly less in the BC compared to the O condition [cumulative accuracy, two-sample t test, t(24) = 22.107, p = 0.045].

Psychology_tweet_45.News Finding: Immune dysfunction in autism. Pathophysiological pathways.
Psychology_tweet_45.Paper Finding: Furthermore, these dysfunctional immune responses are associated with increased impairments in behaviors characteristic of core features of ASD, in particular, deficits in social interactions and communication.
Psychology_tweet_45.News Context: Immune dysfunction in autism. Pathophysiological pathways.
Psychology_tweet_45.Paper Context: Furthermore, these dysfunctional immune responses are associated with increased impairments in behaviors characteristic of core features of ASD, in particular, deficits in social interactions and communication. This review will discuss the current state of our knowledge of immune dysfunction in ASD, how these findings may impact on underlying neuro-immune mechanisms and implicate potential areas where the manipulation of the immune response could have an impact on behavior and immunity in ASD. There is a concordance rate for ASD of 0-37% reported for dizygotic twins, while concordance rates of 44-91% are reported for monozygotic twins (Bailey et al., 1995; Constantino and Todd, 2000; Kates et al., 2004; Steffenburg et al., 1989) , suggesting that genetic composition may contribute to increased risk of developing ASD.
Psychology_tweet_45.text:
['Finding A: Immune dysfunction in autism. Pathophysiological pathways.
Finding B: Furthermore, these dysfunctional immune responses are associated with increased impairments in behaviors characteristic of core features of ASD, in particular, deficits in social interactions and communication.']
Psychology_tweet_45.displayed_text:
Finding A: Immune dysfunction in autism. Pathophysiological pathways.
Finding B: Furthermore, these dysfunctional immune responses are associated with increased impairments in behaviors characteristic of core features of ASD, in particular, deficits in social interactions and communication.

Psychology_510.News Finding: Beckley, who is in the department of psychology and neuroscience at Duke, said the adult-onset group had a history of anti-social behavior back to childhood, but reported committing relatively fewer crimes.
Psychology_510.Paper Finding: Our results showed that most of the official adult-onset men began their antisocial activities during early childhood.
Psychology_510.News Context: Using this unusually rich source of data, the study was able to look at childhood history compared with adult behavior. Beckley, who is in the department of psychology and neuroscience at Duke, said the adult-onset group had a history of anti-social behavior back to childhood, but reported committing relatively fewer crimes. This group reported committing more crimes than folks who had never been convicted, but fewer crimes than people who had been in trouble as juveniles.
Psychology_510.Paper Context: Our results, along with past research (see, for example, , indicate that as a whole, apparent adult-onset offenders are responsible for a small minority of total crime. Our results showed that most of the official adult-onset men began their antisocial activities during early childhood. In fact, on average, official adult-onset men were similar to juvenile-onset men on multiple measures of child and adolescent antisocial behavior.
Psychology_510.text:
['Finding A: Beckley, who is in the department of psychology and neuroscience at Duke, said the adult-onset group had a history of anti-social behavior back to childhood, but reported committing relatively fewer crimes.
Finding B: Our results showed that most of the official adult-onset men began their antisocial activities during early childhood.']
Psychology_510.displayed_text:
Finding A: Beckley, who is in the department of psychology and neuroscience at Duke, said the adult-onset group had a history of anti-social behavior back to childhood, but reported committing relatively fewer crimes.
Finding B: Our results showed that most of the official adult-onset men began their antisocial activities during early childhood.

Psychology_21.News Finding: In total,19 percent of the young volunteers involved in the study reported that they had been physically abusive to a partner during a dating relationship and 68 percent of the volunteers reported to experiencing corporal punishment as children.
Psychology_21.Paper Finding: Results In all, 19% of participants (n = 134) reported physical dating violence perpetration and 68% reported experiencing corporal punishment as children (n = 498).
Psychology_21.News Context: Of the 758 young adults recruited for the study, 61 percent were female. In total,19 percent of the young volunteers involved in the study reported that they had been physically abusive to a partner during a dating relationship and 68 percent of the volunteers reported to experiencing corporal punishment as children. There was a positive relationship between corporal punishment and physical violence during a romantic relationship.
Psychology_21.Paper Context: Results In all, 19% of participants (n = 134) reported physical dating violence perpetration and 68% reported experiencing corporal punishment as children (n = 498). Analysis showed a significant positive association between corporal punishment and physical perpetration of dating violence (OR 1.30, 95% CI 1.07-1.59). Even after controlling for sex, ethnicity, age, parental education, and child physical abuse, childhood corporal punishment was associated significantly with physical dating violence perpetration (aOR 1.29, 95% CI 1.02-1.62).
Psychology_21.text:
['Finding A: In total,19 percent of the young volunteers involved in the study reported that they had been physically abusive to a partner during a dating relationship and 68 percent of the volunteers reported to experiencing corporal punishment as children.
Finding B: Results In all, 19% of participants (n = 134) reported physical dating violence perpetration and 68% reported experiencing corporal punishment as children (n = 498).']
Psychology_21.displayed_text:
Finding A: In total,19 percent of the young volunteers involved in the study reported that they had been physically abusive to a partner during a dating relationship and 68 percent of the volunteers reported to experiencing corporal punishment as children.
Finding B: Results In all, 19% of participants (n = 134) reported physical dating violence perpetration and 68% reported experiencing corporal punishment as children (n = 498).

Psychology_80.News Finding:
Spanking Runs In The Family

Researchers also found that the more children are spanked, the more likely they were to use physical punishment to discipline their own children.
Psychology_80.Paper Finding: Spanking consistently predicted increases in children's aggression over time, regardless of how aggressive children were when the spanking occurred.
Psychology_80.News Context:
"This shows there is a correlation between spanking and negative outcomes and absolutely no correlation between spanking and positive outcomes." Spanking Runs In The Family

Researchers also found that the more children are spanked, the more likely they were to use physical punishment to discipline their own children. This goes to show that the culture of violence is passed down from generation to generation.
Psychology_80.Paper Context: Rather, spanking predicted increases in children's aggression over and above initial levels. Spanking consistently predicted increases in children's aggression over time, regardless of how aggressive children were when the spanking occurred. It is difficult to imagine that a parent would be able to meet all these criteria when administering spanking; indeed, it would likely be both inadvisable and bordering on abusive if parents spanked children following every instance of a given misbehavior.
Psychology_80.text:
['Finding A: Spanking Runs In The Family Researchers also found that the more children are spanked, the more likely they were to use physical punishment to discipline their own children.
Finding B: Spanking consistently predicted increases in children's aggression over time, regardless of how aggressive children were when the spanking occurred.']
Psychology_80.displayed_text:
Finding A: Spanking Runs In The Family Researchers also found that the more children are spanked, the more likely they were to use physical punishment to discipline their own children.
Finding B: Spanking consistently predicted increases in children's aggression over time, regardless of how aggressive children were when the spanking occurred.

Psychology_4.News Finding: In all three cities, the researchers identified new cases of autism in mainstream schools, confirming that there is under-diagnosis of autism in China.
Psychology_4.Paper Finding: Third, in all three cities, new cases of autism were identified by the study in mainstream schools, reflecting current under-diagnosis.
Psychology_4.News Context: In Shenzhen and Jiamusi cities, only data for children in mainstream education was available; in Shenzhen City, 42 out of every 10,000 children in mainstream education had autism, and in Jiamusi City this figure was 19 per 10,000. In all three cities, the researchers identified new cases of autism in mainstream schools, confirming that there is under-diagnosis of autism in China. "Contrary to previous studies, we have shown that the prevalence of autism spectrum conditions in China is in line with that found in the West," said Dr Sophia Xiang Sun, who conducted this study as part of her PhD at Cambridge University and who is now based in the Star Kay Bridge Research Centre for Children with Autism in Xiamen, China.
Psychology_4.Paper Context: Second, in Shenzhen and Jiamusi cities, where only mainstream data were available, prevalence is also in line with Western estimates . Third, in all three cities, new cases of autism were identified by the study in mainstream schools, reflecting current under-diagnosis. Finally, non-significant variation across different cities is seen indicating the need to explore potential variation of autism across diverse Chinese regions with large sample sizes to achieve a fully robust national picture.
Psychology_4.text:
['Finding A: In all three cities, the researchers identified new cases of autism in mainstream schools, confirming that there is under-diagnosis of autism in China.
Finding B: Third, in all three cities, new cases of autism were identified by the study in mainstream schools, reflecting current under-diagnosis.']
Psychology_4.displayed_text:
Finding A: In all three cities, the researchers identified new cases of autism in mainstream schools, confirming that there is under-diagnosis of autism in China.
Finding B: Third, in all three cities, new cases of autism were identified by the study in mainstream schools, reflecting current under-diagnosis.

Psychology_30.News Finding: The study's findings showed that, regardless of cultural background, circumcised boys may run a greater risk of developing ASD.
Psychology_30.Paper Finding: The increased risk of ASD in circumcised boys under the age of 5 years was present among boys in both Muslim and non-Muslim families ( Table 2) .
Psychology_30.News Context: The researchers, who followed the boys up to the age of nine, found that almost 5,000 cases of ASD were diagnosed. The study's findings showed that, regardless of cultural background, circumcised boys may run a greater risk of developing ASD. The researchers noted they also made an unexpected observation of an increased risk of hyperactivity disorder among circumcised boys in non-Muslim families.
Psychology_30.Paper Context: The HR was higher, though not significantly so, for boys circumcised at age 24 months or older (HR ¼ 1.96; 95% CI: 0.93-4.14), an estimate based on only seven cases of ASD in that group ( Table 2) . The increased risk of ASD in circumcised boys under the age of 5 years was present among boys in both Muslim and non-Muslim families ( Table 2) . Risk in this age group was markedly elevated among boys in non-Muslim families (HR ¼ 4.23; 95% CI: 1.90-9.44), a finding based on six ASD cases in circumcised boys versus 1165 cases in intact boys.
Psychology_30.text:
['Finding A: The study\'s findings showed that, regardless of cultural background, circumcised boys may run a greater risk of developing ASD.
Finding B: The increased risk of ASD in circumcised boys under the age of 5 years was present among boys in both Muslim and non-Muslim families ( Table 2) .']
Psychology_30.displayed_text:
Finding A: The study's findings showed that, regardless of cultural background, circumcised boys may run a greater risk of developing ASD.
Finding B: The increased risk of ASD in circumcised boys under the age of 5 years was present among boys in both Muslim and non-Muslim families ( Table 2) .

Psychology_tweet_185.News Finding: 'Upstream Color' in a neuro tweet? LIP neurons exhibit integrative representations of both color & motion features
Psychology_tweet_185.Paper Finding: We focused on neurons that were both color and direction selective using the three-way ANOVA or showed significant color and direction tuning shifts (n = 71) during the DCM task (using different populations led to similar results).
Psychology_tweet_185.News Context: 'Upstream Color' in a neuro tweet? LIP neurons exhibit integrative representations of both color & motion features
Psychology_tweet_185.Paper Context: This raises a question about whether feature encoding in LIP is used to detect and respond to match stimuli. We focused on neurons that were both color and direction selective using the three-way ANOVA or showed significant color and direction tuning shifts (n = 71) during the DCM task (using different populations led to similar results). Responses to match stimuli ( Figure S2A ) were higher than for nonmatch stimuli for both sample A (paired t test, p = 4 3 10 À5 ) and B (p = 0.001) trials.
Psychology_tweet_185.text:
['Finding A: \'Upstream Color\' in a neuro tweet? LIP neurons exhibit integrative representations of both color & motion features
Finding B: We focused on neurons that were both color and direction selective using the three-way ANOVA or showed significant color and direction tuning shifts (n = 71) during the DCM task (using different populations led to similar results).']
Psychology_tweet_185.displayed_text:
Finding A: 'Upstream Color' in a neuro tweet? LIP neurons exhibit integrative representations of both color & motion features
Finding B: We focused on neurons that were both color and direction selective using the three-way ANOVA or showed significant color and direction tuning shifts (n = 71) during the DCM task (using different populations led to similar results).

Psychology_594.News Finding: Hungry shoppers bought more high-calorie foods, many of which were processed snacks and candy.
Psychology_594.Paper Finding: Finally, the positive influence of the hunger manipulation on acquisition held after including mood as a covariate [F(1, 58) = 6.61, P < 0.02].
Psychology_594.News Context: There was, however, a difference in the quality of the foods added to their carts. Hungry shoppers bought more high-calorie foods, many of which were processed snacks and candy. Satiated shoppers tended towards lower-calorie foods such as fruits and fresh vegetables.
Psychology_594.Paper Context: Mood did not influence the acquisition of binder clips (b = -0.048, SE = 0.208, t = -0.23, P > 0.80) or their evaluation (b = 0.058, SE = 0.119, t = 0.49, P > 0.60). Finally, the positive influence of the hunger manipulation on acquisition held after including mood as a covariate [F(1, 58) = 6.61, P < 0.02]. It also had a very small collection of snacks.
Psychology_594.text:
['Finding A: Hungry shoppers bought more high-calorie foods, many of which were processed snacks and candy.
Finding B: Finally, the positive influence of the hunger manipulation on acquisition held after including mood as a covariate [F(1, 58) = 6.61, P < 0.02].']

Finding B: Finally, the positive influence of the hunger manipulation on acquisition held after including mood as a covariate [F(1, 58) = 6.61, P < 0.02].

Psychology_tweet_3.News Finding: @username "Th absence of a gestational connection to th mother may be more problematic ... than th absence of a genetic link"
Psychology_tweet_3.Paper Finding: Conclusions: The absence of a gestational connection to the mother may be more problematic for children than the absence of a genetic link.
Psychology_tweet_3.News Context: @username "Th absence of a gestational connection to th mother may be more problematic ... than th absence of a genetic link"
Psychology_tweet_3.Paper Context: However, maternal distress had a more negative impact on children who were aware of their origins. Conclusions: The absence of a gestational connection to the mother may be more problematic for children than the absence of a genetic link. When the mother's egg and father's sperm are used in IVF and the mother undergoes the pregnancy, the parents have both a genetic and gestational link to the child in the same way as parents of naturally conceived children.
Psychology_tweet_3.text:
['Finding A: @username "Th absence of a gestational connection to th mother may be more problematic ... than th absence of a genetic link"
Finding B: Conclusions: The absence of a gestational connection to the mother may be more problematic for children than the absence of a genetic link.']
Psychology_tweet_3.displayed_text:
Finding A: @username "Th absence of a gestational connection to th mother may be more problematic ... than th absence of a genetic link"
Finding B: Conclusions: The absence of a gestational connection to the mother may be more problematic for children than the absence of a genetic link.
